author: Dean Moses
title: Bronx motorcycle rider busted after nearly mowing down cop while avoiding enforcement operation on Throgs Neck Bridge | amNewYork
text:
Police arrested a motorcycle rider in the Bronx who attempted to avoid an enforcement operation on the Throgs Neck Bridge Wednesday and nearly mowed down an officer.
According to police sources, the wild incident happened just off the Throgs Neck Bridge at around 10:45 a.m. on Aug. 14 during an interagency operation made up of the NYPD, Sheriffâ€™s Office, MTA Police, State Police, and more designed to stop drivers using ghost license plates.
During the enforcement effort, cops say they noticed a man riding a Harley-Davidson southbound across the bridge with an obscured license plate.
When authorities tried to stop the motorcyclist, police say he initially began to pull over but then made a break for it, zooming away and narrowly missing an officer. The getaway attempt failed when the suspect lost control of his motorbike during the chaos and careened into a nearby police cruiser.
Law enforcement sources say the NYPD subsequently took 36-year-old Michele Branca of White Plains into custody. Upon further investigation, they found him in possession of a retractable baton. Arresting officers also learned that his Harley Davidson was also allegedly unregistered and uninsured.
Branca is charged with obstructing governmental administration, fleeing an officer in a motor vehicle, criminal possession of a weapon, reckless endangerment, and reckless driving. He was last cuffed in Queens in 2017 for a suspended license.
As for the Throgs Neck enforcement operation, which is the 35th such operation citywide since March, police say the task force made 10 arrests, seized 47 vehicles, and issued a whopping 539 summonses.

author: Anamika Singh
title: TP LINK CCTV For Home: Top Class Cameras For Unblemished Security
text: - By [Anamika Singh](/authors/anamika-singh) - Thu, 28 Dec 2023 07:08 PM (IST) TP LINK CCTV For Home: When it comes to home security, the best CCTV cameras in India offer a range of reliable CCTV solutions that provide peace of mind and robust surveillance. They boast high-definition video quality, ensuring clear and detailed footage. With features like motion detection and night vision. TP-Link [cameras](https://english.jagran.com/top-deals/electronics/camera) are designed to enhance home security around the clock. Easy setup and compatibility with mobile apps make monitoring your home remotely a seamless experience. Whether you're looking for indoor or outdoor surveillance, the best CCTV for home provides a reliable and user-friendly solution to keep your home safe and secure. TP Link's CCTV systems for home security prioritize user-friendly interfaces and advanced features. The cameras often come equipped with two-way audio, allowing homeowners to communicate with those near the cameras. The mobile app provides convenient access to live feeds, alerts, and playback options, ensuring constant vigilance even when away. With options for both wired and wireless setups. Read More: [Top 5 CCTV Camera Brands In India](https://english.jagran.com/top-deals/electronics/camera/top-5-cctv-camera-brands-in-india-101 ) TP LINK CCTV For Home: Top Picks TP Link CCTV systems cater to various preferences and home configurations. Overall, its commitment to innovation and user convenience makes it the best CCTV camera for home, especially for those seeking effective and accessible home security. | | TP LINK CCTV For Home | | Price In India | |[TP-Link Tapo Video Pan/Tilt Smart Wi-Fi Security Camera](https://www.amazon.in/TP-Link-Security-Rotational-Required-Definition/dp/B095CLQ1PT/?tag=jagrancom01-21) [TP-LINK Tapo 4MP 2K Outdoor CCTV Security Wi-Fi Smart Camera](https://www.amazon.in/2560x1440-Security-Weatherproof-Starlight-Tapo/dp/B098TVZ6TS/?tag=jagrancom01-21) [TP-Link Tapo 3MP 1296p High Definition Outdoor CCTV Security Wi-Fi Smart Camera](https://www.amazon.in/TP-Link-Weatherproof-Definition-Tapo-C310/dp/B08JLR2751/?tag=jagrancom01-21) [TP-Link 4MP 2K QHD Outdoor CCTV Security Wi-Fi Smart Camera](https://www.amazon.in/TP-Link-Outdoor-Security-Camera-2-Way-Vision%EF%BC%8CIndoor/dp/B09YQ27V52/?tag=jagrancom01-21) 1. TP-Link Tapo 360Â° 2MP 1080p Full HD Pan/Tilt Home Security Wi-Fi Smart Camera Seeking the best CCTV cameras in India? Itâ€™s time for you to experience advanced security with the TP-Link Tapo C200 360Â° Pan/Tilt Home Security WiFi Camera which is a comprehensive solution for indoor surveillance. With its 1080p Full HD resolution and 360Â° pan/tilt functionality, it ensures complete coverage of your space. author: Fr. Scott Lewis, S.J
title: God's Word on Sunday: We enter this world only by the grace of God
text: Not only was the divine order immoral from the human point of view, but it also made no sense. Why give the long-awaited gift and then snatch it away? But then again, the sacrifice of Jesus the Son made little sense either. The sacrifice of Isaac was seen as the foreshadowing of the crucifixion. In both cases, however, it was the absolute obedience and trust in God that initiated and accomplished the redemption of humanity. In the story, we have no insight into Abrahamâ€™s thoughts, feeling or emotions. That would be left for later midrashic elaborations of the text. Did Abraham know God so well that he was absolutely certain that God would not allow him to harm his son? That is a somewhat satisfying but unproven hypothesis. The importance of the story is that Abraham did not withhold from God that which was most precious to him â€” his son. He recognized that Isaac did not belong to him, any more than anything belongs to us. All is gift from God, and gifts are not to be hoarded or clung to. We must be prepared and willing to release our grip on what God has given us, confident that we will not be bereft or shortchanged. We came into this world with nothing, and we leave with nothing, except for the wisdom we have gained and the love that we have given and received. We can trust God; God will never let us down. This is echoed in the Letter to the Romans. Paul realized that the generosity and kindness of God in not withholding His son was proof of Godâ€™s love and our salvation. We need not fear condemnation or separation from the love of Christ. We will not be defeated by any negative forces because we are conquerors through the infinite love of Jesus. This is something to contemplate and pray over as we face the insecurities and fears of the age in which we live. Peter, James and John had no idea what Jesus had in store for them when He led them up the mountain that night. They got the shock and scare of their lives, as they discovered that there is a very thin veil between this world and the next. Jesus was surrounded by a brilliant white light and was talking with Moses and Elijah. They had a glimpse of both the realm of the Spirit and the divine presence in Jesus. But they did not understand a thing. Peter interpreted the vision according to the standard religious traditions and blurted out a proposal to build three shrines to commemorate the occasion. At that point they were overshadowed by a dark cloud. Ironically, an encounter with God was often an occasion of darkness. Mount Sinai was covered with darkness and thunder as Moses received the commandments from God. There was also a voice from the cloud reaffirming Jesusâ€™ status as son and beloved of God. It was the same voice and message that was heard at the baptism of Jesus. Many profess belief in who Jesus is but falter in the second part â€” the commandment to listen to Him rather than the voices of the world. We are not good at listening, either to one another or to the Lord. As the experience passed, Jesus warned them not to breathe a word until He had risen from the dead. At this point, they did not understand what rising from the dead meant but they would in time. There is still much that we do not understand fully. We need to constantly reflect on our experience in light of the Spirit. We do ourselves, other people and the Lord a great disservice by claiming to know more than we do and refusing to see things in any other way. God always has more to teach us, but we need to listen.

author: El Caribe
title: Onamet pronostica buen tiempo para este sÃ¡bado
text: La Oficina Ncional de MeteorologÃ­a (Onamet), informÃ³ que para hoy, sÃ¡bado tendremos buen tiempo meteorolÃ³gico debido a la permanencia del sistema de alta presiÃ³n sobre el paÃ­s, observÃ¡ndose un ambiente de nubes aisladas, muchas horas de sol y escasas ocurrencias de lluvias. Entrada la tarde, una dÃ©bil vaguada asociada a un sistema frontal se ubicarÃ¡ sobre el noroeste del paÃ­s, no obstante, solo se presentarÃ¡n algunas lluvias en la Cordillera Central y puntos del suroeste, para el resto seguirÃ¡n las condiciones de buen tiempo. Entrada la noche, no prevemos cambios importantes en las condiciones hasta la medianoche. El domingo, dÃ­a de aÃ±o viejo, se pronostica que debido a un sistema frontal y su vaguada que se moverÃ¡ sobre la isla lentamente perdiendo sus caracterÃ­sticas y desde horas de la madrugada, se observaran nublados con lluvias intermitentes que pueden ser moderadas a fuertes en ocasiones, posibles tronadas y rÃ¡fagas, hacia provincias como: Monte Cristi, Valverde, Puerto Plata, Santiago RodrÃ­guez, SÃ¡nchez RamÃ­rez, Santiago, Espaillat, Hermanas Mirabal, MarÃ­a Trinidad SÃ¡nchez, SamanÃ¡, La Vega, MonseÃ±or Nouel, Duarte, Monte Plata, entre otras cercanas. Para la noche, seguirÃ¡n las lluvias en todo el litoral costero del AtlÃ¡ntico, asÃ­ como, en el valle del Cibao, con viento fresco del nor/noreste. Las temperaturas seguirÃ¡n agradables a frescas, principalmente en zonas montaÃ±osas y los valles del interior, con algunos episodios de nieblas durante la madrugada y primeras horas del dÃ­a, debido a la Ã©poca del aÃ±o. Sin embargo, podrÃ­an sentirse ligeramente cÃ¡lidas en el dÃ­a en las zonas de costas. Distrito Nacional: escasa nubosidad siendo despejado en ocasiones. Santo Domingo este: nubes aisladas pasando a dispersas. Santo Domingo Norte: nubes aisladas o parcialmente nublado. Santo Domingo Oeste: nubes aisladas en ocasiones. El Gran Santo Domingo: temperatura mÃ­nima entre 19 Â°C y 21 Â°C y la mÃ¡xima entre 28 Â°C y 30 Â°C. Resumen: sistema de alta presiÃ³n generando buen tiempo meteorolÃ³gico con escasas lluvias en el paÃ­sâ€¦ Temperaturas agradables en las primeras horas del dÃ­a, ligeramente cÃ¡lidas en la tardeâ€¦ Las costas se encuentran normales. Para fin de aÃ±o y aÃ±o nuevo se pronostican lluvias por sistema frontal y vaguada.

author: Staff Reporter
title: Sister of soldier killed 50 years ago says she remains â€˜devastatedâ€™ by his death - Limerick Live
text: The sister of a soldier killed in an IRA massacre 50 years ago said her family remains devastated by his death. Terence Griffin was killed along with 11 others, including two children aged five and two, in the M62 coach bombing in Yorkshire on February 4 1974. Bombardier Griffin of the Royal Artillery was travelling with other service personnel and family members from Manchester to Catterick when the IRA bomb hidden in the luggage compartment of their coach exploded. Mr Griffinâ€™s sister Mo Norton will join other families and representatives of the Wave Trauma Centre at a memorial service on Sunday at Hartshead Moor Services, West Yorkshire, where many of the casualties were taken after the explosion. Ms Norton said her family was â€œcompletely devastated by Terenceâ€™s killing but there is no hate in meâ€. She was speaking ahead the 50th anniversary of the atrocity. Talking about her brother, Ms Norton added: â€œHe was always good fun, laughing and joking. â€œBut above all he was kind and thatâ€™s not just something a sister would say anyway. Itâ€™s what his friends and colleagues in the army said as well.â€ Ms Norton said her brother had done two tours of duty in Northern Ireland and her family was worried about his safety. She added: â€œBut we never thought anything would happen when he was on leave. He never planned to be travelling by coach because he just didnâ€™t like it. â€œBut there was a train strike and the coach was laid on.â€ She said: â€œMy mum and dad, Terence and my two sisters Kathleen and Barbara were so close and this devastated us all. â€œMy father had been in the RAF for 30 years and he was inconsolable because he felt guilty that he had signed the papers when Terence joined up as soon as he left school. â€œIt was completely misplaced but he was never the same again. He was only 55 years old when he died.â€ Ms Norton added: â€œIt will be hard at the memorial service but having the support of others who have gone through the same experience will be a great help. â€œI will always keep Terenceâ€™s name and memory alive. â€œI wouldnâ€™t want to be anywhere else on Sunday.â€ Subscribe or register today to discover more from DonegalLive.ie Buy the e-paper of the Donegal Democrat, Donegal People's Press, Donegal Post and Inish Times here for instant access to Donegal's premier news titles. Keep up with the latest news from Donegal with our daily newsletter featuring the most important stories of the day delivered to your inbox every evening at 5pm.
